intro: Heterotheca scelionis, commonly known as the silverleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and shrublands. Its silvery-gray foliage and small blue or purple flowers make it visually distinctive. Heterotheca scelionis is generally drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it an adaptable species in arid environments.
